metadata.title: How to Make a YouTube Intro 2025: Templates & Tips
metadata.description: Create an effective YouTube intro. Length, style, and tools for channel branding.

hero.headline: How to Make a YouTube Intro
hero.subheadline: Brand your channel. Short, effective intros that don't lose viewers.

sections.content: YouTube intros establish brand recognition—but they must be short. Long intros kill retention. The modern approach: hook first, brand second, keep it under 5 seconds. Here's how to create intros that work.

sections.title: Creating Your Intro
content: Decide on intro style (animated logo, text, footage)
Place AFTER your hook, not before

content.title: Under 5 Seconds
content.description: Shorter is better. 3 seconds ideal. Long intros hurt retention.

content.title: After the Hook
content.description: Hook viewers first, then intro. Don't intro before value.

content.title: Consistent Branding
content.description: Same intro across videos builds recognition.

faq.question: Do I need an intro?
faq.answer: Not necessarily. Many successful channels have no intro. If you use one, keep it short. Content quality matters more.

faq.question: Where should intro go?
faq.answer: After your hook. Open with value or intrigue first. Then quick intro. Never start with intro—viewers will click away.

faq.question: How long is too long?
faq.answer: Over 5 seconds is too long. 3 seconds is ideal. Long intros are from an older YouTube era. Respect viewer time.

faq.question: Free vs paid templates?
faq.answer: Free templates work fine for most. Canva has great options. Paid gives more unique options and customization.
